title: How North and South Korea Came to March Under One Flag
text: February 09, 2018 How North and South Korea Came to March Under One Flag A flag featuring a silhouette of an undivided Korea continues to stir controversy decades after its creation By Clément Bürge and Crystal Tai Feb. 09, 2018 7:18 pm The star of the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics opening ceremony was a white and blue flag representing a unified Korean peninsula. Here’s the story of a powerful and controversial symbol for two countries that still have guns aimed at each other. Pyeongchang 2018 Video coverage of the 2018 Winter Games in Pyeongchang, South Korea. Up Next in Pyeongchang 2018 Ep.1 Why North Korea Wants to Shine in the Olympic Spotlight Ep.2
